text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits a revision for Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) 4.4.18, Audit Information Management System (AIMS) Procedures and Processing Instructions, Large Dollar Cases.

IRM 4.4.18 has been extensively revised throughout. Names of functional areas have been changed to reﬂect the current organizational structure and the IRM has been reorganized. A summary of signiﬁcant changes is reﬂected below:
This revision supersedes IRM 4.4.18, Large Dollar Cases dated June 11, 2010.
Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) and Wage and Investment (W&I).

Scope and (

) Purpose: The procedures, which were in this IRM, pertained to the Examina- tion Audit Process. The removed procedures do not pertain to the AIMS Information Technologies (IT) System, which is the subject of this IRM. New IRM references for the procedures previously located in this IRM are listed in the material changes. This section provides general instructions for Large Dollar Cases. The Centralized Case Processing (CCP) procedures remaining in this IRM will be included in the new IRM
, Exam Processing, CCP, Organization and Responsibilities. (
) Audience: The audience for this IRM section will be Examination CCP. (
) Policy Owner: The Director: SB/SE Technology Solutions who is under the Director, Operations Support. (
) Program Owner: Examination Systems and Projects, Customer Service. (
) Program Goals: The goal of this section is to provide information and proce- dures on processing Large Dollar Cases. (
) IRM deviations must be submitted in writing to the Director SB/SE Division following instructions from IRM
, Internal Management Documents System - IRM Process. (

) The procedures which were in this IRM, pertained to the Examination Audit Process. The procedures do not pertain to the AIMS IT System, which is the subject of this IRM. New IRM references for the procedures previously located in this IRM are listed in the material changes. CCP procedures remaining in this IRM will be included in the new IRM
, Exam Processing, CCP, Orga- nization and Responsibilities. (

) This chapter covers unique processing instructions for large dollar cases. In determining whether a case should be considered a large dollar case, treat each tax period separately. Exception: Cases over $
million in deﬁciency - See IRM

) Large Dollar By Field Groups (
) All large dollar cases with agreed and unpaid deﬁciencies or overassessments of $
and greater must be ﬂagged on Form
, Special Handling Notice for Examination Case Processing, in the “Expedite Processing” section. In addition the “Over $
Agreed and Unpaid” section of Form
be completed by the ﬁeld group. Requirements for CCP and Technical Services (TS) to complete this section have been removed.
) Processing Agreed and Deﬁciencies (
) This section pertains to income, estate and gift, and certain excise taxes with agreed and unpaid deﬁciencies of $
and greater that are subject to interest-free waiver period under Internal Revenue Code (IRC)
These procedures do not apply to employment tax returns or delinquent returns secured by Examination after a Substitute for Return has posted. (
) The “Expedite Processing” section of the Form
must be completed by ﬁeld group for all case ﬁles with agreed unpaid deﬁciencies or overassess- ments of $
and greater. The $
criteria is not cumulative, but determined per year - See Form
Form
Job Aid . (
) Due to interest paid on the deﬁciency or overassessment, these cases must receive expedite processing. Every effort should be made to assess the deﬁ- ciency within
calendar days of the agreement date if the unpaid deﬁciency is greater than $
In addition, a quick assessment will be necessary only if the
C Date will not be within
calendar days from the agreement date - See IRM
, Audit Information Management System (AIMS) - Validity and Consistency - Quick Assessments. Note: For LB&I cases: If there is an unpaid balance due of $
and greater on an agreed case, the case is referred to Collections. If the case is unagreed, it will close to either TS for Statutory Notice of Deﬁciency or Appeals. (
) Every effort should be made to forward these cases as expeditiously as possible. The following time frames have been established and should be followed: a. The group has
calendar days after receipt of the waiver to forward case for processing. b. TS has
calendar days to review the case if it was forwarded to them. c. CCP has
calendar days to input the case for closure if the case has been through TS. If the case did not go through TS, CCP has
calendar days. (

Reminder: Regardless of the dollar amount, quick assessments are not required on civil penalty assessments because they do not ﬁt the criteria for agreed, unpaid deﬁciencies. However, a quick assessment would be required if the civil penalty had an imminent statute date of less than

) Each year the General Accountability Office (GAO) examines the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) ﬁnancial statements. As a part of this audit, they documentation for taxpayers whose balance due (including interest and penalties) is over $
million dollars. (
) To adequately review this information, copies of forms related to a balance adjustment over $
million are required to be sent to the Office of Unpaid sessment Analysis. (
) Follow the processing procedures below when an assessment results in a balance due of $
million or more. This applies to CCP partial and full closures. (
) When the assessment for a single tax period, not combined or offset by another tax period, will be $
million or more, prepare copies of the informa- tion listed below. a. Deﬁnition of assessment for a single tax period includes a combination of: • Tax to be assessed (example: Transaction Code (TC)
or TC • Tax to be abated (example: TC
or TC
). • Penalties to be assessed. • Interest to be assessed. Deﬁnition of assessment for a single tax period does not include:
Overassessments of $100,000 or more must receive expedite processing See IRM 4.4.18.7, Processing Agreed and Unpaid Deﬁciencies.
Deﬁnition of assessment for a single tax period includes a combination of: Tax to be assessed (example: Transaction Code (TC)
or TC

Deﬁnition of assessment for a single tax period does not include:
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
• Credits on the account. • Offsets to be applied to the account from another tax period. (
